poem:
"In the Throes of a Freefall"

Upon the newsprint, scribed in ink, we stand,
No longer stable, rooted like old trees - 
A game of chairs and frantic, fleeting hands.
Each word, a whisper in democracy's breeze.
Yet, in the rushing face of dissolution,
Some make their anthem: "Out, but with a swing",
The defiant sonnet of an institution,
Unyielding as the muse from which it springs.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Journalism is in freefall. These writers aren’t giving up: ‘We can go out swinging’ The media industry has been in freefall for longer than most of us can remember, but the devastation of late has been happening at warp speed. Workers at newspapers, magazines, and websites across the US are playing a game of musical chairs that is devastating to both their personal livelihoods and the preservation of democracy. In the last few weeks alone,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
